name: A Garden in the Clouds
description:
We didn't finish the game, but you can still try to raise your flowers!

They grow fastest when their environment is moderate. Not too sunny, not too much water, not too much fertilizer, and not too loud of music.  

Moisture and Fertilizer slowly deplete and watercan and fertilizer bag replenishes them quickly. (we didn't have time to add the UI indicators for this, which makes the game more difficult)

Change the volume of the radio by clicking the volume buttons.

Move the pot left to get shade and right to get more sun. Sunlight levels are affected by the weather.

Your plant will look happiest when all their needs are being optimally met.

Unfortunately we didn't quite get done so the Flower Heaven part isn't working very well. The plant *should* die and go to Flower Heaven, but due to a last-minute bug in writing and loading data, you are limited to a handful of pre-generated flowers.

To visit Flower Heaven, click the Cloud at the top right of the shelf. Then select two flowers in the clouds to combine them, then click the thumbs up (or thumbs down to cancel and try another combination). 

Then you can try to grow this plant. 

Art by Sophia Hsu

Programming by John Boyle

Music by Jason Boyle
